title: Discovery of Penicillin
description: Alexander Fleming discovers the first antibiotic at St. Mary's Hospital in London.

title: First Television Demonstration
description: John Logie Baird demonstrates the first working television system.

title: Salt March (Dandi March)
description: Mahatma Gandhi leads a 24-day nonviolent protest march against the British salt monopoly in India.

title: Stock Market Crash (Black Tuesday)
description: The Wall Street crash marks the beginning of the Great Depression.

title: Independence of India
description: India gains independence from British rule after nearly 200 years.

title: Founding of the United Nations
description: The UN is established to maintain international peace and security after WWII.

title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin become the first humans to walk on the moon.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: The wall symbolising the Cold War division of Europe is breached.

title: Dissolution of the Soviet Union
description: The USSR officially ceases to exist marking the end of the Cold War.

title: World Wide Web Public Launch
description: Tim Berners-Lee opens the web to the public.

title: Indian Economic Liberalisation
description: India initiates major economic reforms under Finance Minister Manmohan Singh.

title: First Human Heart Transplant
description: Dr. Christiaan Barnard performs the world's first successful heart transplant.

title: Invention of the Transistor
description: Bell Labs scientists invent the transistor revolutionizing electronics.

title: Discovery of DNA Structure
description: Watson and Crick reveal the double helix structure of DNA.

title: Creation of the Euro
description: The Euro is introduced as an accounting currency in 11 countries.

title: 9/11 Terrorist Attacks
description: Coordinated terrorist attacks hit the World Trade Center and the Pentagon.

title: Launch of the iPhone
description: Apple introduces the first iPhone changing the mobile industry forever.

title: Indian Tsunami
description: A massive tsunami triggered by an undersea earthquake causes devastation in India and Southeast Asia.

title: Mangalyaan (Mars Orbiter Mission)
description: India's first interplanetary mission successfully enters Mars orbit.

title: COVID-19 Pandemic Declaration
description: The WHO declares the coronavirus outbreak a global pandemic.

title: Green Revolution in India
description: India begins a series of initiatives to increase agricultural productivity.

title: Indira Gandhi's Assassination
description: Prime Minister Indira Gandhi is assassinated by her bodyguards.

title: Pokhran-II Nuclear Tests
description: India conducts a series of five nuclear bomb test explosions.

title: Statue of Unity Inauguration
description: The world's tallest statue depicting Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel is inaugurated in Gujarat.

title: Demonetisation in India
description: The Government of India announces the demonetisation of 500 and 1000 rupee notes.

title: Chandrayaan-3 Moon Landing
description: India becomes the first nation to land a spacecraft near the lunar south pole.

title: First General Elections in India
description: India conducts its first democratic elections after independence.

title: Discovery of the Higgs Boson
description: CERN scientists confirm the existence of the "God particle".

title: South Africa's First Democratic Elections
description: Nelson Mandela is elected president as apartheid ends.

title: Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima
description: The first atomic bomb used in warfare is dropped by the US on Japan.

title: Spanish Civil War Starts
description: A major conflict breaks out in Spain leading to the dictatorship of Francisco Franco.

title: Discovery of King Tut's Tomb
description: Howard Carter discovers the intact tomb of the boy king in Egypt.

title: Invention of the Polio Vaccine
description: Jonas Salk develops the first successful vaccine for polio.

title: End of the Vietnam War
description: Saigon falls to North Vietnamese forces ending the long conflict.

title: First Space Shuttle Launch
description: NASA launches Columbia the first reusable spacecraft.

title: Signing of the Magna Carta 800th Anniversary
description: The foundation of modern legal systems celebrated globally.

title: Paris Agreement Signing
description: Countries worldwide commit to climate action at COP21.

title: India Wins its First Cricket World Cup
description: The Indian team led by Kapil Dev defeats the West Indies in London.

title: Establishment of ISRO
description: The Indian Space Research Organisation is formed.

title: Operation Blue Star
description: The Indian military removes militants from the Golden Temple in Amritsar.

title: Kargil War
description: An armed conflict between India and Pakistan in the Kargil district.

title: The Emergency in India
description: Prime Minister Indira Gandhi declares a 21-month state of emergency.

title: Reservation Policy in India (Mandal Commission)
description: The government implements 27% reservation for Other Backward Classes.

title: The Wright Brothers First Flight
description: The first powered and controlled flight by humans (historic context).

title: Signing of the Indian Constitution
description: The Constituent Assembly signs the final document which comes into effect soon after.

title: World War II Ends
description: Victory in Europe and Pacific days mark the end of the global conflict.

title: First Modern Olympic Games
description: The revival of the ancient games takes place in Athens (historic context).

title: Invention of the World Wide Web
description: Tim Berners-Lee proposes the system at CERN.

title: Discovery of Pluto
description: Clyde Tombaugh discovers the ninth planet (later dwarf planet).

title: Assassination of Mahatma Gandhi
description: The father of the nation is shot in Delhi.

title: Inauguration of the Statue of Liberty
description: The monumental gift from France is dedicated in New York (historic context).

title: Construction of the Great Wall of China
description: The wall stretches across thousands of miles to protect dynasties (historic context).

title: Voyager 1 Leaves the Solar System
description: Humanity's first object to reach interstellar space.

title: First Human in Space
description: Yuri Gagarin completes one orbit of Earth.

title: Establishment of the European Union
description: The Maastricht Treaty comes into force.

title: Nelson Mandela's Release
description: The anti-apartheid leader is freed after 27 years.

title: Discovery of Penicillin
description: Alexander Fleming finds the mold that kills bacteria.

title: Indian Air Force Foundation
description: The air arm of the Indian Armed Forces is established.

title: Establishment of IIT Kharagpur
description: The first Indian Institute of Technology is inaugurated.

title: Bhopal Gas Tragedy
description: A lethal gas leak from a Union Carbide plant causes thousands of deaths.

title: Foundation of the Indian National Congress
description: The political organization that led the independent movement (historic context).

title: White Revolution in India
description: Operation Flood makes India the world's largest milk producer.

title: Quit India Movement
description: Mahatma Gandhi launches the movement demanding British withdrawal.

title: Subhash Chandra Bose Forms INA
description: The Indian National Army is revived to fight for independence.

title: Partition of India and Pakistan
description: The division leads to the largest mass migration in human history.

title: Formation of Pakistan
description: Mohammed Ali Jinnah becomes the Governor-General of the new nation.

title: Signing of the Shimla Agreement
description: India and Pakistan sign a peace treaty after the 1971 war.

title: Indira Gandhi Becomes PM
description: First female Prime Minister of India takes office.

title: Narendra Modi Becomes PM
description: The NDA government takes office leading to significant policy changes.

title: Establishment of Reserve Bank of India
description: The central bank of India begins operations.

title: Nationalisation of 14 Major Banks
description: The Indian government nationalises the country's largest private banks.

title: Kumbh Mela 2013
description: The largest religious gathering in human history takes place in Allahabad.

title: Mumbai Terrorist Attacks (26/11)
description: Coordinated attacks by Lashkar-e-Taiba militants across Mumbai.

title: First Successful Nuclear Test by India (Smiling Buddha)
description: India conducts a peaceful nuclear explosion in Pokhran.

title: India Wins 28-Year Drought World Cup
description: MS Dhoni leads India to victory in Mumbai.

title: Launch of GSLV Mark III
description: ISRO launches its heaviest rocket ever.

title: GST Implementation in India
description: The Goods and Services Tax replaces multiple indirect taxes.

title: Sikkim Becomes Part of India
description: The Himalayan kingdom officially joins the Indian union.

title: Bangladesh Liberation War
description: India assists in the creation of a new nation from East Pakistan.

title: First Indian in Space (Rakesh Sharma)
description: Squadron Leader Rakesh Sharma travels aboard Soyuz T-11.

title: Foundation of Bombay Stock Exchange
description: The oldest stock exchange in Asia is established (historic context).

title: Establishment of DRDO
description: Defence Research and Development Organisation is formed.

title: First Asian Games in Delhi
description: The inaugural continental multi-sport event is hosted by India.

title: Indus Valley Civilisation Excavation
description: Major discoveries at Harappa and Mohenjo-Daro (historic context).

title: Battle of Plassey
description: The East India Company defeats the Nawab of Bengal (historic context).

title: Sepoy Mutiny (First War of Independence)
description: Indian soldiers revolt against British rule (historic context).

title: Creation of Andhra State
description: The first state in India formed on a linguistic basis.

title: Formation of Maharashtra and Gujarat
description: The Bombay State is bifurcated leading to two new states.

title: End of Apartheid in South Africa
description: Global celebrations mark the end of racial segregation.

title: Creation of the State of Israel
description: The Jewish state is established in the Middle East.

title: Cuban Missile Crisis
description: A 13-day confrontation between the US and the USSR brings the world to the brink of nuclear war.

title: Chernobyl Nuclear Disaster
description: The worst nuclear power plant accident in history occurs in Ukraine.

title: Hubble Space Telescope Launch
description: NASA puts the first major optical telescope into space.

title: Launch of SpaceX Falcon 1
description: The first private liquid-fueled rocket reaches orbit.

title: First Draft of the Human Genome Project
description: Scientists map the entire human genetic code.

title: Mars Pathfinder Landing
description: The first rover Sojourner explores the Martian surface.

title: Founding of Google
description: Larry Page and Sergey Brin incorporate the search engine giant.

title: Launch of ChatGPT
description: OpenAI releases a conversational AI that changes public perception of technology.

title: Abrogation of Article 370
description: The Indian government revokes the special status of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Ram Mandir Inauguration in Ayodhya
description: A landmark cultural and religious event in Indian history.

title: India Surpasses China in Population
description: India officially becomes the world's most populous nation.

title: Launch of Aditya-L1 Mission
description: India's first solar observatory mission is launched.

title: Announcement of Chandrayaan-4
description: ISRO reveals plans for a lunar sample return mission.
